purpleculture_pinyin:
ài
obstruct, hinder, block, deter
препятствовать, препятствовать, блокировать, сдерживать
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 疑 indicates the sound; 石 (stone) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 石 [ shí ] stone, rock, mineral
    • 疑 [ yí ] to doubt, to question, to suspect
heisig_chinese_memo: A huge stone is obstructing traffic so I doubt anyone will get home on time. &nbsp
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Those gremlins! At day break they insist on coming out and gluing stones all over the place which obstruct me from getting to work!
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " stone " and " doubt ", the original meaning is to limit and block. "Shuowen": "Zhiye. From the stone, the voice of doubt." "Liezi·Liming": "Go alone, come alone, go alone, and who can get in the way."

" Hard " can mean obstacles. Han Yangxiong "Fayan‧ Gentleman": "Isn't the son seeing Yu's journey of water and water? One east and one north, there is no hindrance to the journey."

" Hard " also means obstruction. Emperor Liang Jianwen of the Southern Dynasties "Zhang Yangliu": "Ye Mi and birds fly in the way, the wind is light and the flowers are late."

" Hard " also expresses concern. "Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 22: "At that time, I entered the empty door, nothing was hindered, everything was silent."

" Hinder " also means covering. One of Tang Dufu's "Seeing Wang Jianbing and Ma Shi said that there are two white and black eagles near the mountains": "Peng obstructs the nine days but avoids the beard, and the rabbit hides in the three caves.
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " stone " and " doubt ", the original meaning is to limit and block.
humanum_full_description:
從「石」，「疑」聲，本義為限止、阻擋。《說文》：「止也。从石，疑聲。」《列子‧力命》：「獨往獨來，獨出獨入，孰能礙之。」

　　「礙」可表示障礙。漢揚雄《法言‧君子》：「子未睹禹之行水與？一東一北，行之無礙也。」

　　「礙」還表示妨礙。南朝梁簡文帝〈折楊柳〉：「葉密鳥飛礙，風輕花落遲。」

　　「礙」亦表示牽掛。《兒女英雄傳》第22回：「那時我身入空門，一身無礙，萬緣俱寂。」

　　「礙」還表示遮蔽。唐杜甫〈見王監兵馬使說近山有白黑二鷹〉之一：「鵬礙九天須卻避，兔藏三窟莫深憂。」
humanum_short_description: 從「石」，「疑」聲，本義為限止、阻擋。

Freq: 6767
Chinese: A huge stone is obstructing traffic so I doubt anyone will get home on time.  
Meaning: obstruct
Hanzi: 碍
Story: Those gremlins! At day break they insist on coming out and gluing stones all over the place which obstruct me from getting to work!
Kind: traditional

從「 石 」，「 疑 」聲，本義為限止、阻擋。《說文》：「止也。从石，疑聲。」《列子‧力命》：「獨往獨來，獨出獨入，孰能礙之。」 「 礙 」可表示障礙。漢揚雄《法言‧君子》：「子未睹禹之行水與？一東一北，行之無礙也。」 「 礙 」還表示妨礙。南朝梁簡文帝〈折楊柳〉：「葉密鳥飛礙，風輕花落遲。」 「 礙 」亦表示牽掛。《兒女英雄傳》第22回：「那時我身入空門，一身無礙，萬緣俱寂。」 「 礙 」還表示遮蔽。唐杜甫〈見王監兵馬使說近山有白黑二鷹〉之一：「鵬礙九天須卻避，兔藏三窟莫深憂。」
From the sound of " stone" and " doubt", the original meaning is to limit and block. "Shuowen": "Zhiye. From the stone, the voice of doubt." "Liezi·Liming": "Go alone, come alone, go alone, and who can get in the way." " Hard" can mean obstacles. Han Yangxiong "Fayan‧ Gentleman": "Isn't the son seeing Yu's journey of water and water? One east and one north, there is no hindrance to the journey." " Hard" also means obstruction. Emperor Liang Jianwen of the Southern Dynasties "Zhang Yangliu": "Ye Mi and birds fly in the way, the wind is light and the flowers are late." " Hard" also expresses concern. "Heroes of the Sons and Daughters" Chapter 22: "At that time, I entered the empty door, nothing was hindered, everything was silent." " Hinder" also means covering. One of Tang Dufu's "Seeing Wang Jianbing and Ma Shi said that there are two white and black eagles near the mountains": "Peng obstructs the nine days but avoids the beard, and the rabbit hides in the three caves.

礙字的基本解释

礙
ài
见“碍”。

礙字的汉语字典释义

[①]［ài］
［《廣韻》五溉切，去代，疑。］
亦作“1”。“碍1”的繁体字。亦作“碍1”。
(1)限止；阻挡。
(2)妨碍。
(3)障碍。
(4)牵挂。
(5)遮蔽。
(6)见“礙夜”。

礙字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【石字部】　礙； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页837第46
【唐韻】五漑切【集韻】【韻會】牛代切，?音硋。或作硋。通作閡。南史引浮屠書作㝵。【說文】止也。又距也，妨也，阻也，?也。【揚子·法言】聖人之治天下，礙諸以禮樂。　又【集韻】魚其切，音疑。礙?，靑石。　又叶魚記切，音詣。【蘇轍·嶽下詩】山林無不容，疲苶坐自礙，自知俗緣深，畢老收闤闠。闠，求位切。

礙字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

暂无。

[①]［ài］
["Guangyun" five cuts, disregards, doubts. ]
Also called "1". The traditional characters of "Impedance 1". Also referred to as "obstacle 1".
(1) Limit; block.
(2) Obstacle.
(3) Obstacles.
(4) Worry about.
(5) Shading.
(6) See "obstructing the night".
